qas.question: In recent years, has the amount of social networking sites available to the public increased or decreased?
What percentage of 12-17 year olds claim to have at least one social networking profile?
What percentage of teens say they text every day?
What percentage of teens report visiting social netorking sites daily?
What ratio of teens are "heavy" social media users, using two types of media daily?

context: Within the past ten years, the amount of social networking sites available to the public has <a0_0>greatly increased<a0_0/> as well as the number of adolescents using them. Several sources report a high proportion of adolescents who use social media: <a1_0>73%<a1_0/> of 12–17 year olds reported having at least one social networking profile; two-thirds (<a2_0>68%<a2_0/>) of teens text every day, half (<a3_0>51%<a3_0/>) visit social networking sites daily, and 11% send or receive tweets at least once every day. In fact, more than a third (34%) of teens visit their main social networking site several times a day. <a4_0>One in four (23%)<a4_0/> teens are "heavy" social media users, meaning they use at least two different types of social media each and every day.
